# Arpeggio: sus4 in D

## Brief Description
An arpeggio is the playing of the notes of a chord in a broken sequence. The sus4 arpeggio in the key of D consists of the notes D, G, and A. The sus4 chord includes a root (D), a perfect fourth (G), and a perfect fifth (A). This arpeggio has a tension-filled and mysterious quality, adding an alluring flavor to musical compositions.

## Notes and Intervals
- D (root)
- G (perfect fourth)
- A (perfect fifth)

## Musical Genre and Flavor
The sus4 arpeggio in D is often used in various genres such as rock, pop, and jazz. It adds a sense of tension and interest to the music, creating a unique and somewhat mysterious sound. Its use can evoke feelings of contemplation, suspense, or resolution depending on the context in which it's played.

## Songs Using D sus4 Arpeggio
1. *"Stairway to Heaven" by Led Zeppelin*: This iconic rock song features the D sus4 arpeggio in the famous opening guitar riff played by Jimmy Page.
   
2. *"Clocks" by Coldplay*: In this pop-rock hit, the D sus4 arpeggio is used in the piano accompaniment throughout the song, adding a dreamy and contemplative element to the music.
   
3. *"So What" by Miles Davis*: This jazz classic utilizes the D sus4 arpeggio in the improvisational sections, contributing to the harmonic complexity and colorful texture of the piece.
